attributes.action: abolish the offence for failing to repeatedly declare an unchanged SORN
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It is an offence to be the registered keeper of a vehicle that is unlicensed and does not have SORN (Statutory Off-Road Notification) declared.
SORN declarations must be made immediately, and renewed annually, "to ensure that name, address and vehicle details on the register are up to date".

However, since it is already an offence to change the vehicle or owners details without notifying the DVLA, in the case where there has been no change in the vehicle's or owners details, why is there a seperate offence for failing to re-declare SORN?
Is that not wasteful of resources and/or extortion?
